duties_responsibilities.duty: Review and prepare data and demographics on recently discharged patients for initial assessment call with a Nurse Coach.
Collect and document required data for end-to-end seamless care and generate reports for clinical program's goals.
Make non-clinical outreach to patients to ensure successful home recovery and check in on non-clinical issue resolution.
Responsible for speaking with physicians and coordinating in-home care for the patient.
Participate in and contribute to performance and process improvement activities.
Monitor and support clinicians to ensure service levels and requirements are met.
Meet or exceed weekly efficiency and quality metrics. Monitor and support clinicians to ensure service levels and requirements are met.
Provide feedback when implementing process changes and raise opportunities to leadership ensuring compliance to policies, legal requirements and regulatory mandates.
Perform other duties as required or assigned.
Provide outreach to patients with incoming calls and questions, and escalate issues to Nurse Coaches or management when appropriate.
Participate in performance and process improvement activities and must be committed to high-quality standards.
Based on business needs, evening and weekend coverage may be needed.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or equivalent. Minimum of two years insurance, quality improvement, or healthcare operations required.
